result.execSummary:
The defendant Sasha N Clemente was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sasha N Clemente is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sasha N Clemente was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is sentenced to 5 days in the Dane County Jail.  That jail term is stayed for completion of 40 hours of community service.
$67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sasha N Clemente

Zoom

Defendant appeared via video.  Awais Khaleel appeared for the State of Wisconsin via video. Pre-trial conference  held remotely through Zoom due to COVID-19 Health Pandemic. Defn completed CDP application and appealed Collections decision. CT granted defn's appeal. Defn to complete CDP down payment no later than Friday, April 1. CT to set PTC when counsel appointed.
Initial Application Denied

Defendant not eligible for court appointed counsel through Dane County - income over established guideline.

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.

Zoom
Pre-trial conference on March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Trial Judge - Br 5 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:49 AM Defendant appeared.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
